definition: lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
to fight/fight/war/battle

sentences.english: It's nerve-wracking to watch the games that law enforcement and drug dealers play with each other.
sentences.chinese: 看執法部門和毒販之間的貓鼠遊戲讓人心驚膽戰。

sentences.english: Another form of the advancing state is more insidious.
sentences.chinese: 政府擴張的另一個形式更加讓人心驚膽戰。

sentences.english: Dry bread is better with love than friend chicken with fear and trembling.
sentences.chinese: 相親相愛喫乾麪包勝過心驚膽戰喫油炸雞。

sentences.english: gasped Mr. Dimmesdale, overcome with terror.
sentences.chinese: 丁梅斯代爾先生心驚膽戰地喘着氣說。

sentences.english: Sons of Gondor, of Rohan, my brothers. I see in your eyes the same fear that would take the heart of me.
sentences.chinese: 我從你們眼裏看到，你們跟我一樣都恐懼得心驚膽戰。

definition: reckless/extremely daring
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to whisper to one another's ear
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
a short time/a little while
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
masquerade
young and vigorous (idiom)
an iron ring
to withdraw/to hole up
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4
